oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Poster to hear U.S. Senate Candidate K. D. McKellar speak
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Poster advertising a campaign speech by K. D. McKellar, candidate for Senate, for the Democratic primary run-off. He is advertised as speaking in Charlotte and Dickson. His description includes "The Man of the Hour," "Clean Record," "Staunch Democrat," "Re-Unite the Party."
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides
Broadsides; Elections; Legislators -- United States
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Kenneth Douglas McKellar was born in 1869. He was elected to the Senate in 1916 and was re-elected five times, serving from March 1917 to January 1953, finally losing his seat to Albert Gore in the 1952 election. He served as President Pro-Tempore in the Seventy-Ninth, Eighty-First, and Eighty-Second Congresses. He retired in 1953 and died in 1957.
